docs.lead_paragraph: THIS collection of Washington Irving's letters became known to Irving students only when it was presented, in 1928, to Harvard University. None of them has heretofore been published. With two exceptions, says Mr. Williams in his preface, it is the largest extant collection of letters written by Irving to any individual or family.

headline.main: Miscellaneous Brief Reviews; WASHINGTON IRVING AND THE STORROWS. Letters from England and the Continent, 1821-1828. Edited, with a preface, by Stanley T. Williams. Illustrated. 136 pp. Cambridge: Harvard University Press. $2. Books in Brief Review
